name: Pickthall
text: Blessed is He Who hath revealed unto His slave the Criterion (of right and wrong), that he may be a warner to the peoples.

name: Pickthall
text: He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, He hath chosen no son nor hath He any partner in the Sovereignty. He hath created everything and hath meted out for it a measure.

name: Pickthall
text: Yet they choose beside Him other gods who create naught but are themselves created, and possess not hurt nor profit for themselves, and possess not death nor life, nor power to raise the dead.

name: Pickthall
text: Those who disbelieve say: This is naught but a lie that he hath invented, and other folk have helped him with it, so that they have produced a slander and a lie.

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: Fables of the men of old which he hath had written down so that they are dictated to him morn and evening.

name: Pickthall
text: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He who knoweth the secret of the heavens and the earth hath revealed it. Lo! He ever is Forgiving, Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: What aileth this messenger (of Allah) that he eateth food and walketh in the markets? Why is not an angel sent down unto him, to be a warner with him.

name: Pickthall
text: Or (why is not) treasure thrown down unto him, or why hath he not a paradise from whence to eat? And the evil-doers say: Ye are but following a man bewitched.

name: Pickthall
text: See how they coin similitudes for thee, so that they are all astray and cannot find a road!

name: Pickthall
text: Blessed is He Who, if He will, will assign thee better than (all) that - Gardens underneath which rivers flow - and will assign thee mansions.

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but they deny (the coming of) the Hour, and for those who deny (the coming of) the Hour We have prepared a flame.

name: Pickthall
text: When it seeth them from afar, they hear the crackling and the roar thereof.

name: Pickthall
text: And when they are flung into a narrow place thereof, chained together, they pray for destruction there.

name: Pickthall
text: Pray not that day for one destruction, but pray for many destructions!

name: Pickthall
text: Say: Is that (doom) better or the Garden of Immortality which is promised unto those who ward off (evil)? It will be their reward and journey's end.

name: Pickthall
text: Therein abiding, they have all that they desire. It is for thy Lord a promise that must be fulfilled.

name: Pickthall
text: And on the day when He will assemble them and that which they worship instead of Allah and will say: Was it ye who misled these my slaves or did they (themselves) wander from the way?

name: Pickthall
text: They will say: Be Thou Glorified! it was not for us to choose any protecting friends beside thee; but Thou didst give them and their fathers ease till they forgot the warning and became lost folk.

name: Pickthall
text: Thus they will give you the lie regarding what ye say, then ye can neither avert (the doom) nor obtain help. And whoso among you doeth wrong, We shall make him taste great torment.

name: Pickthall
text: We never sent before thee any messengers but lo! they verily ate food and walked in the markets. And We have appointed some of you a test for others: Will ye be steadfast? And thy Lord is ever Seer.

name: Pickthall
text: And those who look not for a meeting with Us say: Why are angels not sent down unto us and (Why) do we not see our Lord! Assuredly they think too highly of themselves and are scornful with great pride.

name: Pickthall
text: On the day when they behold the angels, on that day there will be no good tidings for the guilty; and they will cry: A forbidding ban!

name: Pickthall
text: And We shall turn unto the work they did and make it scattered motes.

name: Pickthall
text: Those who have earned the Garden on that day will be better in their home and happier in their place of noonday rest;

name: Pickthall
text: A day when the heaven with the clouds will be rent asunder and the angels will be sent down, a grand descent.

name: Pickthall
text: The Sovereignty on that day will be the True (Sovereignty) belonging to the Beneficent One, and it will be a hard day for disbelievers.

name: Pickthall
text: On the day when the wrong-doer gnaweth his hands, he will say: Ah, would that I had chosen a way together with the messenger (of Allah)!

name: Pickthall
text: Alas for me! Ah, would that I had never taken such an one for friend!

name: Pickthall
text: He verily led me astray from the Reminder after it had reached me. Satan was ever man's deserter in the hour of need.

name: Pickthall
text: And the messenger saith: O my Lord! Lo! mine own folk make this Qur'an of no account.

name: Pickthall
text: Even so have We appointed unto every prophet an opponent from among the guilty; but Allah sufficeth for a Guide and Helper.

name: Pickthall
text: And those who disbelieve say: Why is the Qur'an not revealed unto him all at once? (It is revealed) thus that We may strengthen thy heart therewith; and We have arranged it in right order.

name: Pickthall
text: And they bring thee no similitude but We bring thee the Truth (as against it), and better (than their similitude) as argument.

name: Pickthall
text: Those who will be gathered on their faces unto hell: such are worse in plight and further from the right road.

name: Pickthall
text: We verily gave Moses the Scripture and placed with him his brother Aaron as henchman.

name: Pickthall
text: Then We said: Go together unto the folk who have denied Our revelations. Then We destroyed them, a complete destruction.

name: Pickthall
text: And Noah's folk, when they denied the messengers, We drowned them and made of them a portent for mankind. We have prepared a painful doom for evil-doers.

name: Pickthall
text: And (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, and the dwellers in Ar-Rass, and many generations in between.

name: Pickthall
text: Each (of them) We warned by examples, and each (of them) We brought to utter ruin.

name: Pickthall
text: And indeed they have passed by the township whereon was rained the fatal rain. Can it be that they have not seen it? Nay, but they hope for no resurrection.

name: Pickthall
text: And when they see thee (O Muhammad) they treat thee only as a jest (saying): Is this he whom Allah sendeth as a messenger?

name: Pickthall
text: He would have led us far away from our gods if we had not been staunch to them. They will know, when they behold the doom, who is more astray as to the road.

name: Pickthall
text: Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust? Wouldst thou then be guardian over him?

name: Pickthall
text: Or deemest thou that most of them hear or understand? They are but as the cattle - nay, but they are farther astray?

name: Pickthall
text: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord hath spread the shade - And if He willed He could have made it still - then We have made the sun its pilot;

name: Pickthall
text: Then We withdraw it unto Us, a gradual withdrawal?

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who maketh night a covering for you, and sleep repose, and maketh day a resurrection.

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who sendeth the winds, glad tidings heralding His mercy, and We send down purifying water from the sky,

name: Pickthall
text: That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give many beasts and men that We have created to drink thereof.

name: Pickthall
text: And verily We have repeated it among them that they may remember, but most of mankind begrudge aught save ingratitude.

name: Pickthall
text: If We willed, We could raise up a warner in every village.

name: Pickthall
text: So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them herewith with a great endeavour.

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who hath given independence to the two seas (though they meet); one palatable, sweet, and the other saltish, bitter; and hath set a bar and a forbidding ban between them.

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who hath created man from water, and hath appointed for him kindred by blood and kindred by marriage; for thy Lord is ever Powerful.

name: Pickthall
text: Yet they worship instead of Allah that which can neither benefit them nor hurt them. The disbeliever was ever a partisan against his Lord.

name: Pickthall
text: And We have sent thee (O Muhammad) only as a bearer of good tidings and a warner.

name: Pickthall
text: Say: I ask of you no reward for this, save that whoso will may choose a way unto his Lord.

name: Pickthall
text: And trust thou in the Living One Who dieth not, and hymn His praise. He sufficeth as the Knower of His bondmen's sins,

name: Pickthall
text: Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six Days, then He mounted the Throne. The Beneficent! Ask anyone informed concerning Him!

name: Pickthall
text: And when it is said unto them: Prostrate to the Beneficent! they say: And what is the Beneficent? Are we to prostrate to whatever thou (Muhammad) biddest us? And it increaseth aversion in them.

name: Pickthall
text: Blessed be He Who hath placed in the heaven mansions of the stars, and hath placed therein a great lamp and a moon giving light!

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who hath appointed night and day in succession, for him who desireth to remember, or desireth thankfulness.

name: Pickthall
text: The (faithful) slaves of the Beneficent are they who walk upon the earth modestly, and when the foolish ones address them answer: Peace;

name: Pickthall
text: And who spend the night before their Lord, prostrate and standing,

name: Pickthall
text: And who say: Our Lord! Avert from us the doom of hell; lo! the doom thereof is anguish;

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! it is wretched as abode and station;

name: Pickthall
text: And those who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor grudging; and there is ever a firm station between the two;

name: Pickthall
text: And those who cry not unto any other god along with Allah, nor take the life which Allah hath forbidden save in (course of) justice, nor commit adultery - and whoso doeth this shall pay the penalty;

name: Pickthall
text: The doom will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein disdained for ever;

name: Pickthall
text: Save him who repenteth and believeth and doth righteous work; as for such, Allah will change their evil deeds to good deeds. Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: And whosoever repenteth and doeth good, he verily repenteth toward Allah with true repentance -

name: Pickthall
text: And those who will not witness vanity, but when they pass near senseless play, pass by with dignity.

name: Pickthall
text: And those who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord, fall not deaf and blind thereat.

name: Pickthall
text: And who say: Our Lord! Vouchsafe us comfort of our wives and of our offspring, and make us patterns for (all) those who ward off (evil).

name: Pickthall
text: They will be awarded the high place forasmuch as they were steadfast, and they will meet therein with welcome and the ward of peace,

name: Pickthall
text: Abiding there for ever. Happy is it as abode and station!

name: Pickthall
text: Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): My Lord would not concern Himself with you but for your prayer. But now ye have denied (the Truth), therefor there will be judgment.
